text: Can be identified at sight in the field by anyone with a bit of experience. Species with which the beginner rapidly becomes familiar, and which may be identifiable from a photo.  Records acceptable from most sources.

Can be identified in the field with care and experience. Beginners may need to take specimens until they gain familiarity and experience, but some may be identifiable from a good photo.  Records acceptable from competent recorders.

Specimen needs checking with chemical tests or microscopic examination. Records acceptable from known experienced recorders unless the date, region or habitat is unusual. Beginners should get specimens checked at first until they gain experience.
Voucher specimen should be retained. Confirmation by an acknowledged expert will be required in most cases.

Even the most expert of recorders would seek a second opinion, and the specimen may need to be submitted to international experts for comparison with a wider range of material. Records only accepted after checking by an acknowledged expert.
